introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content1: Percisio ("we," "our," or "us") is committed to protecting the privacy and security of your personal information and protected health information (PHI). This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our medical assistance platform and related services.
introduction.content2: This Privacy Policy applies to all users of Percisio's services, including healthcare professionals, medical institutions, and patients whose data may be processed through our platform.

personal.intro: We may collect the following types of personal information:
items: Account Information: Name, email address, professional credentials, institutional affiliation, and contact information
Professional Information: Medical license numbers, specialty areas, certifications, and professional qualifications
Usage Data: Information about how you interact with our platform, including login times, feature usage, and system performance data
Communication Data: Records of communications with our support team, feedback, and service requests

phi.title: 2.2 Protected Health Information (PHI)

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about Percisio

whatIsPercisio.question: What is Percisio?
whatIsPercisio.answer: Percisio is a cutting-edge medical assistance system powered by computer vision technology. It provides real-time guidance for image-guided procedures, helping clinicians achieve precision with ≤2mm accuracy while reducing procedure times by up to 40%.

howDoesItWork.question: How does Percisio work?
howDoesItWork.answer: Percisio uses advanced computer vision algorithms to track medical instruments in real-time. It creates holographic roadmaps from CT, MRI, and ultrasound data, providing clinicians with precise guidance during procedures through augmented reality visualization.

whatProcedures.question: What procedures does Percisio support?
whatProcedures.answer: Percisio supports a wide range of percutaneous interventions including biopsies, infiltrations, punctures, and drainage procedures. It's compatible with ultrasound probes, clinical needles, and various other medical instruments.

accuracy.question: What is the accuracy of Percisio?
accuracy.answer: Percisio achieves ≤2mm mean guidance error on needle trajectory, measured on test bench and anatomical phantoms. This high precision helps reduce the need for multiple attempts and control images.

setupTime.question: How long does it take to set up Percisio?
setupTime.answer: The complete calibration process takes less than 3 minutes from power on to ready-to-use state. Our streamlined workflow ensures minimal preparation time without compromising accuracy.

radiationReduction.question: How does Percisio reduce radiation exposure?
radiationReduction.answer: Percisio reduces the need for control images by 40%, significantly decreasing radiation exposure for both patients and medical staff. The precise guidance reduces the number of attempts needed for successful procedures.

compatibility.question: Is Percisio compatible with existing equipment?
compatibility.answer: Yes, Percisio is designed to work with existing medical equipment. It's compatible with ultrasound systems, CT scanners, MRI machines, and various medical instruments commonly used in percutaneous procedures.

training.question: What training is required for Percisio?
training.answer: Percisio features an intuitive interface designed for medical professionals. We provide comprehensive training programs including hands-on workshops, online modules, and ongoing support to ensure successful implementation.

maintenance.question: What maintenance does Percisio require?
maintenance.answer: Percisio requires minimal maintenance. Regular software updates are provided automatically, and our support team conducts periodic system checks to ensure optimal performance. Hardware maintenance is minimal due to our robust design.

dataSecurity.question: How is patient data protected?
dataSecurity.answer: Percisio is HIPAA compliant with enterprise-level security. All data is encrypted end-to-end, and we follow strict privacy protocols to ensure patient information remains secure and confidential.

pricing.question: How is Percisio priced?
pricing.answer: Percisio pricing is based on your institution's specific needs and usage patterns. We offer flexible licensing options including per-procedure, annual subscriptions, and enterprise packages. Contact our sales team for a customized quote.

support.question: What support is available?
support.answer: We provide 24/7 technical support, regular software updates, comprehensive training programs, and ongoing consultation services. Our expert support team is available to help with any questions or issues.

clinicalValidation.question: Is Percisio clinically validated?
clinicalValidation.answer: Yes, Percisio has been extensively tested and validated in clinical settings. Our technology is trusted by over 500 hospitals worldwide and has been used in thousands of successful procedures.

integration.question: How does Percisio integrate with hospital systems?
integration.answer: Percisio integrates seamlessly with existing hospital IT infrastructure, PACS systems, and electronic health records. Our team works closely with your IT department to ensure smooth integration and workflow optimization.

future.question: What future developments are planned?
future.answer: We continuously develop new features and applications based on clinical feedback. Upcoming developments include expanded procedure support, enhanced AI algorithms, and improved integration capabilities with emerging technologies.

biopsy.title: Biopsy
biopsy.subtitle: End-to-end guidance for minimally invasive biopsies.

hepatic.intro1: The drainage procedure is one of the great classics of interventional radiology. Reaching a hepatic abscess with PERCISIO Guidance becomes faster, safer, and more intuitive. The system provides a 3D holographic visualization of the liver and surrounding organs, allowing the operator to plan and monitor the needle trajectory in real time while minimizing the risk of injury to vessels or neighboring structures.
hepatic.imageAlt: Hepatic drainage procedure with PERCISIO guidance showing holographic visualization
hepatic.para2: The illustration shows a holographic volume precisely positioned over the abscess area, together with a virtual needle path. These elements, included in the patient's holographic overlay, provide all the essential data required for the accurate execution of the procedure. The software also relies on depth information and the target volume dimensions to authorize the intervention.
hepatic.para3: PERCISIO only validates actions that remain within its certified precision range, ensuring procedural safety and maintaining the accuracy expected for image-guided interventions. By combining markerless body tracking, CT-based volumetric data, and augmented guidance overlays, PERCISIO enables precise percutaneous access to deep or complex lesions.
hepatic.para4: This results in shorter procedure times, reduced radiation exposure, and greater operator confidence, both in clinical practice and in training environments.

biopsy.imageAlt: Biopsy procedure with PERCISIO guidance showing 3D holographic visualization of liver and target nodule
biopsy.para1: The image shows a suspected hepatic metastasis, requiring an interventional biopsy for histopathological confirmation. This type of procedure demands careful planning to avoid major vessels and to ensure accurate sampling of the target tissue.
biopsy.para2: With PERCISIO Guidance, the operator visualizes the liver and the target nodule as a 3D holographic volume perfectly aligned with the patient's anatomy. The hologram displays the planned needle path, the entry point, and the distance to the lesion, enabling safe and intuitive guidance throughout the approach.
biopsy.para3: If the target area is too small or too deep to guarantee full accuracy within PERCISIO's certified precision range, the system can be used to guide the initial trajectory and bring the needle as close as possible to the lesion. The practitioner can then complete the final step under CT control, combining PERCISIO's spatial guidance with conventional imaging for optimal precision.
biopsy.para4: This hybrid workflow enhances diagnostic reliability, operator safety, and overall procedural efficiency, while maintaining full compatibility with standard interventional protocols.

pleural.imageAlt: Pleural drainage procedure with PERCISIO guidance showing 3D holographic visualization
pleural.para1: Pleural effusion is a common condition resulting from the accumulation of fluid within the pleural cavity, which can compress the lung and cause shortness of breath, chest pain, and respiratory discomfort. The fluid may be serous, hemorrhagic, purulent, or chylous, depending on the underlying cause — such as heart failure, infection, malignancy, or trauma.
pleural.para2: When the effusion becomes large, loculated, or symptomatic, a pleural drainage procedure is indicated to remove the fluid and allow the lung to re-expand. Under image guidance, a catheter is inserted through the chest wall into the pleural space, providing immediate decompression and clinical relief. The evacuated fluid can also be analyzed to determine its nature and guide further treatment.
pleural.para3: In complex or deep collections, where access is limited by ribs, diaphragm, or adjacent organs, PERCISIO Guidance assists in planning and visualizing the drainage trajectory to optimize safety and accuracy.
